00017 namespace Passenger {

00019 using namespace std;
00020 using namespace boost;
00021 
00022 /**
00023  * Represents a single Ruby on Rails application instance.
00024  */
00025 class Application {
00026 public:
00027         class Session;
00028         /** A type for callback functions that are called when a session is closed.
00029          * @see Application::connect()
00030          */
00031         typedef function<void (Session &session)> CloseCallback;
00032         /** Convenient alias for Session smart pointer. */
00033         typedef shared_ptr<Session> SessionPtr;
00034         
00035         /**
00036          * Represents the life time of a single request/response pair.
00037          *
00038          * A Session object can be used to send request data and to receive response data.
00039          * A usage example is shown in Application::connect().
00040          *
00041          * A session is said to be closed when the Session object is destroyed.
00042          */
00043         class Session {
00044         public:
00045                 // TODO: Finalize API. sendBody() doesn't do anything yet.
00046                 // Also document when exactly the writer socket is closed.
00047                 virtual ~Session() {}
00048                 
00049                 virtual void sendHeaders(const string &headers) {
00050                         int writer = getWriter();
00051                         ssize_t ret;
00052                         unsigned int written = 0;
00053                         const char *data = const_cast<const string &>(headers).c_str();
00054                         do {
00055                                 do {
00056                                         ret = write(writer, data + written, headers.size() - written);
00057                                 } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00058                                 if (ret == -1) {
00059                                         throw SystemException("An error occured while writing headers to the request handler", errno);
00060                                 } else {
00061                                         written += ret;
00062                                 }
00063                         } while (written < headers.size());
00064                         closeWriter();
00065                 }
00066                 
00067                 virtual void sendBody(const string &body) { /* TODO */ }
00068                 
00069                 virtual int getReader() = 0;
00070                 virtual void closeReader() = 0;
00071                 virtual int getWriter() = 0;
00072                 virtual void closeWriter() = 0;
00073         };
00074 
00075 private:
00076         /**
00077          * A structure containing data that both StandardSession and Application
00078          * may access. Since Application and StandardSession may have different
00079          * life times (i.e. one can be destroyed before the other), they both
00080          * have a smart pointer referencing a SharedData structure. Only
00081          * when both the StandardSession and the Application object have been
00082          * destroyed, will the SharedData object be destroyed as well.
00083          */
00084         struct SharedData {
00085                 unsigned int sessions;
00086         };
00087         
00088         typedef shared_ptr<SharedData> SharedDataPtr;
00089 
00090         /**
00091          * A "standard" implementation of Session.
00092          */
00093         class StandardSession: public Session {
00094         protected:
00095                 SharedDataPtr data;
00096                 CloseCallback closeCallback;
00097                 int reader;
00098                 int writer;
00099                 
00100         public:
00101                 StandardSession(SharedDataPtr data, const CloseCallback &closeCallback, int reader, int writer) {
00102                         this->data = data;
00103                         this->closeCallback = closeCallback;
00104                         data->sessions++;
00105                         this->reader = reader;
00106                         this->writer = writer;
00107                 }
00108         
00109                 virtual ~StandardSession() {
00110                         data->sessions--;
00111                         closeReader();
00112                         closeWriter();
00113                         closeCallback(*this);
00114                 }
00115                 
00116                 virtual int getReader() {
00117                         return reader;
00118                 }
00119                 
00120                 virtual void closeReader() {
00121                         if (reader != -1) {
00122                                 close(reader);
00123                                 reader = -1;
00124                         }
00125                 }
00126                 
00127                 virtual int getWriter() {
00128                         return writer;
00129                 }
00130                 
00131                 virtual void closeWriter() {
00132                         if (writer != -1) {
00133                                 close(writer);
00134                                 writer = -1;
00135                         }
00136                 }
00137         };
00138 
00139         string appRoot;
00140         pid_t pid;
00141         int listenSocket;
00142         time_t lastUsed;
00143         SharedDataPtr data;
00144 
00145 public:
00146         /**
00147          * Construct a new Application object.
00148          *
00149          * @param theAppRoot The application root of a RoR application, i.e. the folder that
00150          *             contains 'app/', 'public/', 'config/', etc. This must be a valid directory,
00151          *             but the path does not have to be absolute.
00152          * @param pid The process ID of this application instance.
00153          * @param listenSocket The listener socket of this application instance.
00154          * @post getAppRoot() == theAppRoot && getPid() == pid
00155          */
00156         Application(const string &theAppRoot, pid_t pid, int listenSocket) {
00157                 appRoot = theAppRoot;
00158                 this->pid = pid;
00159                 this->listenSocket = listenSocket;
00160                 lastUsed = time(NULL);
00161                 this->data = ptr(new SharedData());
00162                 this->data->sessions = 0;
00163                 P_TRACE("Application " << this << ": created.");
00164         }
00165         
00166         virtual ~Application() {
00167                 close(listenSocket);
00168                 P_TRACE("Application " << this << ": destroyed.");
00169         }
00170         
00171         /**
00172          * Returns the application root for this RoR application. See the constructor
00173          * for information about the application root.
00174          */
00175         string getAppRoot() const {
00176                 return appRoot;
00177         }
00178         
00179         /**
00180          * Returns the process ID of this application instance.
00181          */
00182         pid_t getPid() const {
00183                 return pid;
00184         }
00185         
00186         /**
00187          * Connect to this application instance with the purpose of sending
00188          * a request to the application. Once connected, a new session will
00189          * be opened. This session represents the life time of a single
00190          * request/response pair, and can be used to send the request
00191          * data to the application instance, as well as receiving the response
00192          * data.
00193          *
00194          * The use of connect() is demonstrated in the following example.
00195          * @code
00196          *   // Connect to the application and get the newly opened session.
00197          *   Application::SessionPtr session(app->connect("/home/webapps/foo"));
00198          *   
00199          *   // Send the request headers and request body data.
00200          *   session->sendHeaders(...);
00201          *   session->sendBody(...);
00202          *
00203          *   // Now read the HTTP response.
00204          *   string responseData = readAllDataFromSocket(session->getReader());
00205          *
00206          *   // This session has now finished, so we close the session by resetting
00207          *   // the smart pointer to NULL (thereby destroying the Session object).
00208          *   session.reset();
00209          *
00210          *   // We can connect to an Application multiple times. Just make sure
00211          *   // the previous session is closed.
00212          *   session = app->connect("/home/webapps/bar")
00213          * @endcode
00214          *
00215          * Note that a RoR application instance can only process one
00216          * request at the same time, and thus only one session at the same time.
00217          * You <b>must</b> close a session when you no longer need if. You you
00218          * call connect() without having properly closed a previous session,
00219          * you might cause a deadlock because the application instance may be
00220          * waiting for you to close the previous session.
00221          *
00222          * @return A smart pointer to a Session object, which represents the created session.
00223          * @param closeCallback A function which will be called when the session has been closed.
00224          * @post this->getSessions() == old->getSessions() + 1
00225          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during the connection process.
00226          * @throws IOException Something went wrong during the connection process.
00227          */
00228         SessionPtr connect(const CloseCallback &closeCallback) const {
00229                 int ret;
00230                 do {
00231                         ret = write(listenSocket, "", 1);
00232                 } while ((ret == -1 && errno == EINTR) || ret == 0);
00233                 if (ret == -1) {
00234                         throw SystemException("Cannot request a new session from the request handler", errno);
00235                 }
00236                 
00237                 try {
00238                         MessageChannel channel(listenSocket);
00239                         int reader = channel.readFileDescriptor();
00240                         int writer = channel.readFileDescriptor();
00241                         return ptr(new StandardSession(data, closeCallback, reader, writer));
00242                 } catch (const SystemException &e) {
00243                         throw SystemException("Cannot receive one of the session file descriptors from the request handler", e.code());
00244                 } catch (const IOException &e) {
00245                         string message("Cannot receive one of the session file descriptors from the request handler");
00246                         message.append(e.what());
00247                         throw IOException(message);
00248                 }
00249         }
00250         
00251         /**
00252          * Get the number of currently opened sessions.
00253          */
00254         unsigned int getSessions() const {
00255                 return data->sessions;
00256         }
00257         
00258         /**
00259          * Returns the last value set by setLastUsed(). This represents the time
00260          * at which this application object was last used.
00261          *
00262          * This is used by StandardApplicationPool's cleaner thread to determine which
00263          * Application objects have been idle for too long and need to be cleaned
00264          * up. Thus, outside StandardApplicationPool, one should never have to call this
00265          * method directly.
00266          */
00267         time_t getLastUsed() const {
00268                 return lastUsed;
00269         }
00270         
00271         /**
00272          * Set the time at which this Application object was last used. See getLastUsed()
00273          * for information.
00274          *
00275          * @param time The time.
00276          * @post getLastUsed() == time
00277          */
00278         void setLastUsed(time_t time) {
00279                 lastUsed = time;
00280         }
00281 };
00282 
00283 /** Convenient alias for Application smart pointer. */
00284 typedef shared_ptr<Application> ApplicationPtr;
00285 
00286 } // namespace Passenger
